title: Coconut
subtitle: Fruit with many uses
desc1: The coconut is not only edible but has plenty of other uses as well. Coconut water is a popular thirst-quencher. As it is enclosed in a shell, it is totally sanitised and it has some curative properties too. The Malays use it as an antidote for various ailments such as diarrhoea, nausea, high fever and measles. The fruit of an evergreen plant which grows only in the tropics, the coconut is refreshing in hot weather, tasty and boasts of many nutrients too.
desc2: You can easily get 257 mg of potassium from a 100 g serving of coconut. Besides that, it has also substantial amounts of phosphorus and calcium which are necessary for strong bones and teeth. What's more, this wonder fruit also has fair amounts of Vitamins B1, B2 and C. It is a high energy giving fruit too, providing as much as 384 kcal per 100 g edible portion.
